"""adding name column to member and health monitor Revision ID: 44a2414dd683 Revises: c11292016060 Create Date: 2016-12-19 13:14:58.879793 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '44a2414dd683' down_revision = 'c11292016060' from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa tables = ['member', 'health_monitor'] def upgrade(): for table in tables: op.add_column( table, sa.Column(u'name', sa.String(255), nullable=True) )

subject: Kill processes when cleaning up namespaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-24 16:35:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/43771f5d2fc08d323508dca2bfe1b8d18d03af87', 'message': "Kill processes when cleaning up namespaces

This patch will look for processes that are listening on any port/UNIX socket
within the namespace to be cleaned up and kill them. To kill them it will
issue a SIGTERM and, if they don't die after a few seconds, a SIGKILL.

This is intended for those cases when there's no specific cleanup and serves
as a callback method

Change-Id: I4195f633ef4a1788496d1293846f19eef89416aa

commit_message:
Kill processes when cleaning up namespaces

This patch will kill processes that are listening on any port/UNIX
socket within the namespace to be cleaned up. To kill them it will
issue a SIGTERM to them (or to their parents if they were forked) and,
if they don't die after a few seconds, a SIGKILL to them and all their
children.

This is intended for those cases when there's no specific cleanup and
serves as a fallback method.

Change-Id: I4195f633ef4a1788496d1293846f19eef89416aa
Partial-Bug: #1403455
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/40/402140/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import signalfrom neutron._i18n import _LWfrom neutron.agent.linux import utilsSIGTERM_WAITTIME = 5def find_listen_pids_namespace(namespace): """Retrieve a list of pids of listening processes within the given netns It executes netstat -nNlp and returns a set of unique pairs """ ip = ip_lib.IPWrapper(namespace=namespace) pids = set() cmd = ['netstat', '-nlp'] output = ip.netns.execute(cmd, run_as_root=True) for line in output.splitlines()[2:]: R = re.search(r'.* (?P<pid>\d{2,6})/.*', line) if R: pids.add(R.group('pid')) return pids def kill_process(pid, signal): try: utils.execute(['kill', '-%d' % signal, pid], run_as_root=True) except Exception as ex: stale_pid = (isinstance(ex, RuntimeError) and 'No such process' in str(ex)) if not stale_pid: LOG.exception(_LE('An error occurred while killing [%s].'), pid) return False return True def _kill_listen_processes(namespace, signal): pids = find_listen_pids_namespace(namespace) for pid in pids: LOG.warning(_LW("Killing (%(signal)d) [%(pid)s] %(cmdline)s"), {'signal': signal, 'pid': pid, 'cmdline': ' '.join(utils.get_cmdline_from_pid(pid))[:80]}) kill_process(pid, signal) return bool(pids) def kill_listen_processes(namespace): """Kill all processes listening within the given namespace. First it tries to kill them using SIGTERM, wait for a while and then kills remaining processes with SIGKILL """ if _kill_listen_processes(namespace, signal.SIGTERM): time.sleep(SIGTERM_WAITTIME) _kill_listen_processes(namespace, signal.SIGKILL) kill_listen_processes(namespace)

commit_message:
Fix tempest api plugin

Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85 removes the
class variable from tempest - 'default_params_with_timeout_values'
This was kept in tempest only to be used for baremetal tests.
Due to that, trove tempest tests are failing:
http://logs.openstack.org/62/406162/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-trove-ubuntu-xenial/

Each Temepst plugin should either have their own config options
for build timeout etc or use the default one.

Currently we will use the Compute timeouts.

Change-Id: I41834ae552aa02611aab0d09ce8cd9f2ae067e00

commit_message:
Introduce content argument

Copy module can take content argument, I think we should introduce this
feature to config_template. It brings the possibility to use lookups for
inline passing of content to template.

Example, we could use:

config_template:
  content: "{{ lookup('file',<file>) }}" to replace current behavior

or:

config_template:
  content: "{{ lookup('url','<url>',wantlist=True) | join ('\n') }}"

to bring inline templating of external sources.

Change-Id: Id5b2743d309f0313603afbbf84279ce0b1e49cfb
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Fixing partial path detection for Windows

This commit updates the check for a partial path in the shell
plugin to recognize Windows paths (c:\something\) as complete
paths.

Change-Id: I0e6e3b83f5464e2fe4b06bc72632bb950b5e3d7e
Closes-Bug: #1650392

commit_message:
Add build-essential package dependency to amphora-agent element

With the recent changes, gcc is not pulled in anymore on CentOS, and
compilation of the python modules fails in the amphora-agent element

To be on the safe side, this adds the build-essential dependency
to make sure these modules can be buillt

Change-Id: I842b07cbc3e48209fd500bff5cc798be655f0ae9

subject: Modify memory calculation formula for MySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 14:32:46.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/database/database.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/0d7f92adb595914ab81834af215210822780b0d2', 'message': "Modify memory calculation formula for MySQL

- Optimize memory calculation formula. From one hand we want to limit
  MySQL to allocate not more than 50% of RAM. From other hand we want to
  have 1024 or greater connections. So, if environment has 2GB MySQL
  will allocate 1720Mb, if environment has 3 GB it will allocate 1984Mb
  of RAM. It will allocate 50% of RAM if server has 4.5+ GB. The higher
  limit will have action if server has 37+GB. In that case MySQL will
  allocate less than 50% of RAM.
- Pass key_buffer_size in megabytes rather than bytes.
- Remove query_cache_type, query_cache_type from fuel_override_options
  hash, as these settings are galera specific, so they should be
  explicitly in wsrep_options hash
- Remove myisam_sort_buffer_size. OpenStack services use InnoDB engine,
  so MyISAM optimazation should be disabled. The only DB which uses
  MyISAM is 'mysql'. The default value 8M is enough

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1648766

Change-Id: Ia48f94936fcd3090208e4e485d7c9cbfea3c0ed4
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Modify memory calculation formula for MySQL

- Optimize memory calculation formula. From one hand we want to limit
  MySQL to allocate not more than 50% of RAM. From other hand we want to
  have 1024 or greater connections. So, if environment has 2GB MySQL
  will allocate 1720Mb, if environment has 3 GB it will allocate 1984Mb
  of RAM. It will allocate 50% of RAM if server has 4.5+ GB. The higher
  limit will have action if server has 37+GB. In that case MySQL will
  allocate less than 50% of RAM.
- Pass key_buffer_size in megabytes rather than bytes.
- Remove query_cache_type, query_cache_type from fuel_override_options
  hash, as these settings are galera specific, so they should be
  explicitly in wsrep_options hash
- Remove myisam_sort_buffer_size. OpenStack services use InnoDB engine,
  so MyISAM optimazation should be disabled. The only DB which uses
  MyISAM is 'mysql'. The default value 8M is enough

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1648766

Change-Id: Ia48f94936fcd3090208e4e485d7c9cbfea3c0ed4
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/14/413114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix dependency issues between tasks

DB tasks should wait for galera explicitly. There shouldn't be
conditions when primary-database is done, allowing *-db tasks to create
users while galera is syncing with other nodes. That causes split brain
as *-db tasks create users in MyISAM tables which is not handled by
Galera.

Closes-Bug: #1636841
Change-Id: I729ba0f2bfce1e731de36c932f5f0350e91adb22
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix regex for python-ironic-inspector-client docs job

Currently both trusty and xenial jobs run on any job for
python-ironic-inspector-client.

Fix the regex so that the trusty job is never run and the xenial job
only run on master and ocata forward.

Change-Id: I2f3b17f48c963d516d82cc5582441bdf249b87f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/05/413005/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This job should not be run anywhere but is part of the python-jobs # template. So, make it only run on a non-existing branch. - name: ^gate-python-ironic-inspector-client-docs-ubuntu-trusty$ branch: ^stable/thisbranchnamewillneverexist$ - name: ^gate-python-ironic-inspector-client-docs-ubuntu-xenial$

Change-Id: I4d1fe347c8006e14bc0fe3c61b3783e9039648b7

commit_message:
Whitelist bash in tox.ini for zuul

Avoid these lines in every output of the layout gate job with
whitelisting bash:

WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/bash
  env: /home/aj/vcs/OpenStack/openstack-infra/project-config/.tox/zuul
Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the
whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Also, order list of external commands alphabetically.

Change-Id: I4d1fe347c8006e14bc0fe3c61b3783e9039648b7

commit_message:
Enable DB 'sync' action when enable_selective_topology_distribution

This patch refactors the run_db_poll method in df_local_controller
and combines the sync code in df_local_controller and topology.
Also this patch add capability to sync nb db when get DB 'sync'
action and enable_selective_topology_distribution is True.

Closes-Bug: #1627980
Change-Id: Id0173e62c3810859e9b16b677750747e2bc9822e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/92/378192/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.register_chassis() self.create_tunnels() # enable_selective_topo_dist will pull topology from ovs port # online event if not self.enable_selective_topo_dist: self.run_db_poll() else: self.sync_finished = True self.topology.sync_topology_with_db()
deleted_lines: self.run_db_poll() self.sync_finished = True self.nb_api.sync() self.register_chassis() self.create_tunnels() if not self.enable_selective_topo_dist: self.read_switches() self.read_security_groups() self.port_mappings() self.read_routers() self.read_floatingip() def read_switches(self): lswitches_to_remove = self.db_store.get_lswitch_keys() for lswitch in self.nb_api.get_all_logical_switches(): self.logical_switch_updated(lswitch) if lswitch.get_id() in lswitches_to_remove: lswitches_to_remove.remove(lswitch.get_id()) for lswitch_to_remove in lswitches_to_remove: self.logical_switch_deleted(lswitch_to_remove) def port_mappings(self): ports_to_remove = self.db_store.get_port_keys() for lport in self.nb_api.get_all_logical_ports(): self.logical_port_updated(lport) if lport.get_id() in ports_to_remove: ports_to_remove.remove(lport.get_id()) for port_to_remove in ports_to_remove: self.logical_port_deleted(port_to_remove) def read_routers(self): routers_to_remove = self.db_store.get_router_keys() for lrouter in self.nb_api.get_routers(): self.router_updated(lrouter) if lrouter.get_id() in routers_to_remove: routers_to_remove.remove(lrouter.get_id()) for router_to_remove in routers_to_remove: self.router_deleted(router_to_remove) def read_security_groups(self): secgroups_to_remove = self.db_store.get_security_group_keys() for secgroup in self.nb_api.get_security_groups(): self.security_group_updated(secgroup) if secgroup.get_id() in secgroups_to_remove: secgroups_to_remove.remove(secgroup.get_id()) for secgroup_to_remove in secgroups_to_remove: self.security_group_deleted(secgroup_to_remove) def read_floatingip(self): fips_to_remove = self.db_store.get_floatingip_keys() for floatingip in self.nb_api.get_floatingips(): self.floatingip_updated(floatingip) if floatingip.get_id() in fips_to_remove: fips_to_remove.remove(floatingip.get_id()) for fip_to_remove in fips_to_remove: self.floatingip_deleted(fip_to_remove)

commit_message:
Fix misleading info in CreateNetwork

Creating docker network with existing Neutron network, if we pass
network name in Option, neutron_uuid is None.

This patch fix the misleading log info, using neutron_name or
neutron_uuid.

Change-Id: I02b1b0dedcf390619863f9e641b18ddb636bd189
Closes-Bug: #1650125
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/15/411115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: "successfully"), neutron_uuid)

commit_message:
Separate unit tests from fullstack tests

With this patch the tox command only runs the unit tests at
./fuxi/tests/unit folder. Another test job is added for fullstack
which is meant to be run only with a working devstack setup and
will run at the gate with tempest. You can run the tests there
for debugging with 'tox -e fullstack'

Change-Id: I2942ccfdf9a97dce331de9b27d9c485de3e112c3
Partial-Implements: blueprint fullstack-testing
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuxi refs/changes/31/403931/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:fullstack] basepython = python2.7 setenv = OS_TEST_PATH=./fuxi/tests/fullstack

commit_message:
Pin only gate mitaka jobs to master

The intent of this rule was to run changes against master of certain
projects against older clouds like mitaka. So we had a rule that said
run all these ubuntu-trusty-mitaka jobs against only master.
Unfortunately I think this prevented the periodic mitaka jobs from
running as they are branchless.

Simple fix is pin to master only when gate- is the job name prefix as
all the periodic jobs start with periodic.

Change-Id: I6eb09d9138e7076c4a93d2de3771204f8a6a4197
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/61/412661/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: - name: ^.*-ubuntu-trusty-(liberty|mitaka)(-nv)?$

commit_message:
Delete kuryr-subnet in existing Neutron network

When we create docker network using existing Neutron network,
we should delete the subnet created by kuryr.
Otherwise, there will leave the subnet and subnetpool undeleted.

Change-Id: Ieb93bb935e52fb5cd3043a1c5c60656b93a37298
Closes-Bug: #1650130

commit_message:
Make munch aware assertEqual test method

Many of our assertEqual calls use compare munches. When there is a
problem, the printout of the munch is all on one line, which makes
reading it hard. Make an assertEqual in our base class which turns
munches into dicts if they're passed in.

Change-Id: I478548c5146cd6f86b8957f527ccd3d78268156f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/04/412104/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import munch def assertEqual(self, first, second): '''Munch aware wrapper''' if isinstance(first, munch.Munch): first = first.toDict() if isinstance(second, munch.Munch): second = second.toDict() return super(TestCase, self).assertEqual(first, second)

commit_message:
Extract assertion method for asserting calls made

The pattern of asserting a list of calls were made comes up over and
over. Let's encode it into a method.

Change-Id: I43186abbc807eab4da1b88469fe29bb7f0dd83b9

commit_message:
Add variable to control cinder backups

Heat has a `backups_enabled` configuration parameter that controls
whether heat will attempt to use cinder's backup service:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332851/

By default, this feature is enabled in heat, but heat doesn't have
any idea if the feature is enabled in cinder. If the backup service
is disabled in cinder but enabled in heat, deployers may create
undeletable stacks.

This patch adds a new variable, `heat_cinder_backups_enabled` that
controls heat's ability to use cinder's backup service. It is
disabled by default (to match the backup service configuration in
the cinder role, which is also disabled by default).

Closes-Bug: 1650035
Change-Id: I3875cc34ec92ba588d995a6d9c0341977a408ad7
(cherry picked from commit 6497309af883766d8455a6b7dc75d1270a117ae3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_heat refs/changes/75/413175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## Cinder backups heat_cinder_backups_enabled: false

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 17:11:37.000000000', 'files': ['reno/scanner.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/reno/commit/fc5ac7f495740af382411bcb9737bf03cb256491', 'message': "use dulwich's tree traversal to look up repo contents

commit_message:
use dulwich's tree traversal to look up repo contents

dulwich.objects.Tree has a method lookup_path() that returns the
permissions and sha associated with a name of a thing under the
Tree (either another Tree instance or a Blob containing a file). This
change replaces the logic we have in our RenoRepo subclass for
traversing Trees with calls to lookup_path(), while still retaining
separate methods for handling the return value appropriately based on
context.

Change-Id: I29a91fa31313918e3dee9e41340b21a55cb8fa90
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/23/411423/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mode, tree_sha = tree.lookup_path(self.get_object, path.encode('utf-8')) else: tree = self[tree_sha] return tree try: mode, blob_sha = tree.lookup_path(self.get_object, filename.encode('utf-8')) except KeyError: # Some part of the filename wasn't found, so the file is # not present. Return the sentinel value. return None else: blob = self[blob_sha] return blob.data
deleted_lines: if os.sep in path: # The tree entry will only have a single level of the # directory name, so if we have a / in our filename we # know we're going to have to keep traversing the # tree. prefix, _, trailing = path.partition(os.sep) mode, subtree_sha = tree[prefix.encode('utf-8')] subtree = self[subtree_sha] return self._get_subtree(subtree, trailing) else: # The tree entry will point to the SHA of the contents # of the subtree. mode, sha = tree[path.encode('utf-8')] result = self[sha] return result def _get_file_from_tree(self, filename, tree): "Given a tree object, traverse it to find the file." try: if os.sep in filename: # The tree entry will only have a single level of the # directory name, so if we have a / in our filename we # know we're going to have to keep traversing the # tree. prefix, _, trailing = filename.partition(os.sep) mode, subtree_sha = tree[prefix.encode('utf-8')] subtree = self[subtree_sha] return self._get_file_from_tree(trailing, subtree) else: # The tree entry will point to the blob with the # contents of the file. mode, file_blob_sha = tree[filename.encode('utf-8')] file_blob = self[file_blob_sha] return file_blob.data except KeyError: # Some part of the filename wasn't found, so the file is # not present. Return the sentinel value. return None return self._get_file_from_tree(filename, tree)

subject: Add variable to control cinder backups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 22:06:31.000000000', 'files': ['templates/heat.conf.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/cinder-backups-e615607a558248cd.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_heat/commit/6497309af883766d8455a6b7dc75d1270a117ae3', 'message': "Add variable to control cinder backups

Heat has a `backups_enabled` configuration parameter that controls
whether heat will attempt to use cinder's backup service:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332851/

By default, this feature is enabled in heat, but heat doesn't have
any idea if the feature is enabled in cinder. If the backup service
is disabled in cinder but enabled in heat, deployers may create
undeletable stacks.

This patch adds a new variable, `heat_cinder_backups_enabled` that
controls heat's ability to use cinder's backup service. It is
disabled by default (to match the backup service configuration in
the cinder role, which is also disabled by default).

Closes-Bug: 1650035
Change-Id: I3875cc34ec92ba588d995a6d9c0341977a408ad7
"}]
commit_message:
Add variable to control cinder backups

Heat has a `backups_enabled` configuration parameter that controls
whether heat will attempt to use cinder's backup service:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332851/

By default, this feature is enabled in heat, but heat doesn't have
any idea if the feature is enabled in cinder. If the backup service
is disabled in cinder but enabled in heat, deployers may create
undeletable stacks.

This patch adds a new variable, `heat_cinder_backups_enabled` that
controls heat's ability to use cinder's backup service. It is
disabled by default (to match the backup service configuration in
the cinder role, which is also disabled by default).

Closes-Bug: 1650035
Change-Id: I3875cc34ec92ba588d995a6d9c0341977a408ad7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_heat refs/changes/76/410976/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## Cinder backups heat_cinder_backups_enabled: false

commit_message:
Added enable_ipset to ovs and linuxbridge agents

The option when turned on will also install ipset package, if it's not installed
already. The ipset option helps with the performance with using iptables.

Change-Id: I35e0686dec8e96a29cbeeed7707e69b29562c3d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/60/319460/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Added enable_ipset configuration parameter to neutron::plugin::ml2 - Added ipset package install if enable_ipset is true.

commit_message:
Add pools wrapper class to create multiple pools

This change adds a pools wrapper class to create multiple pools from a hash passed
into the class, along similar lines of the ceph::osds and ceph::mons wrapper class.

Change-Id: I66a72a18e0401ae2d6a6254e55b75d4df32b85b3

commit_message:
Allow fs creation if mountpoint is not specified

Such services as Swift-storage require partition with file
system without mountpoints, currently fuel-agent prevents
to do that.

Change-Id: Id9e90f81098de3736e0d9b1ca82e434122efd4e8
Closes-bug: #1650622

commit_message:
Revert "Tweak trove devstack plugin"

This reverts commit 47971156f3c4f625da2ea28487cd22b2c5c39450.

Change-Id: Iee3ba150cdd457fe0c3d2f2247c9b76cf26321d4

deleted_lines: # tweak_nova() - update the nova hypervisor configuration if possible function tweak_nova { if [ -e /sys/module/kvm_*/parameters/nested ]; then reconfigure_nova="F" if [ -e /sys/module/kvm_intel/parameters/nested ]; then if [[ "$(cat /sys/module/kvm_*/parameters/nested)" == "Y" ]]; then reconfigure_nova="Y" else echo_summary "Found Intel with no support for nested KVM." fi elif [ -e /sys/module/kvm_amd/parameters/nested ]; then if [[ "$(cat /sys/module/kvm_*/parameters/nested)" == "1" ]]; then reconfigure_nova="Y" else echo_summary "Found AMD with no support for nested KVM." fi fi if [ "${reconfigure_nova}" == "Y" ]; then echo_summary "Configuring Nova to use KVM." NOVA_CONF_DIR=${NOVA_CONF_DIR:-/etc/nova} NOVA_CONF=${NOVA_CONF:-${NOVA_CONF_DIR}/nova.conf} iniset $NOVA_CONF libvirt cpu_mode "none" iniset $NOVA_CONF libvirt virt_type "kvm" else virt_type=$(iniget $NOVA_CONF libvirt virt_type) echo_summary "Nested hypervisor not supported, using ${virt_type}." fi else virt_type=$(iniget $NOVA_CONF libvirt virt_type) echo_summary "Unable to configure Nova to use KVM, using ${virt_type}." echo "Unable to configure Nova to use KVM, using ${virt_type}." fi } tweak_nova

subject: Adjust how we pin (or not) Tempest depending on where we're running
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 13:49:33.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/b6243b1617be5d07480c2fdd30785c035637b238', 'message': "Adjust how we pin (or not) Tempest depending on where we're running

We don't want to pin Tempest if we're running inside the Tempest gate.
This allows their patchsets to be properly tested inside the p-o-i jobs
that are running there.

If we're not running inside the Tempest gate, pin to whatever version
is in TEMPEST_VERSION.

Change-Id: If2221480fb13a69e64adc26fa6bc211bf563bfa8
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust how we pin (or not) Tempest depending on where we're running

We don't want to pin Tempest if we're running inside the Tempest gate.
This allows their patchsets to be properly tested inside the p-o-i jobs
that are running there.

If we're not running inside the Tempest gate, pin to whatever version
is in TEMPEST_VERSION.

Change-Id: If2221480fb13a69e64adc26fa6bc211bf563bfa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/90/413090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Tempest pin due to issue described in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412511/ # Pin Tempest to TEMPEST_VERSION unless we're running inside the # openstack/tempest gate. if [[ "${ZUUL_PROJECT}" != "openstack/tempest" ]]; then pushd /tmp/openstack/tempest git reset --hard $TEMPEST_VERSION popd fi pushd /tmp/openstack/tempest popd
deleted_lines: fi pushd /tmp/openstack/tempest # we don't pin Tempest in Tempest gate, so we can actually run # real tests in order to fix Tempest. if [ "$ZUUL_PROJECT" != "openstack/tempest" ] && [ ! -z ${ZUUL_PROJECT+x} ]; then # openstack/tempest/master interface breaks Trove and more services. # There is an attempt to fix it here: # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412511/ # Let's pin Tempest until the fix works and is merged.popd

commit_message:
fix mitaka gate grab bag

Since I84e3be748af10b158037866e1ee4c1375b2c3541, the internal method
_error_checker() is changed and the ceilometer gate is broken.
This patch fixes it.

(cherry picked from commit e6ff08801ca34536680b43ca896f0dfdf66c761f)

something changed and expected logs are in stdout rather than stderr
even though it does makes sense as stdout. i have no idea why it
was writing to stderr earlier when it shouldn't have.

Related-Bug: #1635042
(cherry picked from commit 1695b4774e69e032151a47e0435b7af72826e5b6)

The API changed and the Ceilometer driver does not work anymore with it.

Related-Bug: #1613419
(cherry picked from commit 2b6fb87180dbedcd0a60323b587ecd8eec535d7b)

Change-Id: Ifaa1e02f5bc30725124d581c9127713260f755dc

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-cinderclient.

Change-Id: Iac0c8a6bcfa9a74a2e836d156642b1e0abf5ec31

commit_message:
Specification for Magnum stats API

blueprint magnum-stats-api
Change-Id: I97a3ac0bf96208e1c8d909271fe770dff5532898
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/37/391537/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================ Magnum Admin API ================ Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/magnum-admin-api At present, there is no admin/management API for Magnum service. This proposal is to introduce a new management API to provide useful information to OpenStack administrators and service providers/operators. Problem Description ------------------- This document proposes admin/management API for Magnum. Current public API is targeted at the users of the Magnum system and propsed admin API is expected to be used by system administrators or service providers/operators. For example, administrator in an enterprise IT department or a service provider such as Rackspace can use this admin API to get some useful information such as overall current usage (total number number of clusters and nodes ) or a specific customer usage information. Initial proposal is to implement an admin API that can provide active cluster and nodes count. Use Cases --------- Below given are some of the use cases that can be addressed by implmenting an admin API for Magnum. 1. Magnum service provider or user with admin role can get the current usage statistics such as total active clusters and nodes. A service provider could use this information to track the service adoption rate and capacity planning. 2. Operator/Administrator would like to know top N customers (based on number of clusters/nodes). At present this is not possible. 3. Currently an Operator/Administrator can not get usage statistics of a specific customer or overall system. 4. Operator can use admin API to know stats about various cluster types(How many swarm, kubernetes, Mesos clusters were created) Proposed Changes ---------------- In the initial implementation, implment Magnum admin endpoints which provide total number of clusters, nodes across all users and also for specific given user. 1. Add an endpoint that returns total number of clusters, nodes of all users. 2. Add an endpoint that returns total number of clusters, nodes of a specific user. 3. Update policy.json file and restrict access to above mentioned endpoint access to users with admin role. Initial work in progress review [2]. Alternatives ------------ Currently there is no admin/management API for Magnum service. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- A new '/admin' REST endpoint will be introduced with this proposed change. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee vijendar-komalla Work Items ---------- 1. Implment an admin endpoint in Magnum service. 2. Update Magnum client to expose new admin endpoints. 3. Document new admin API. Dependencies ------------ None Testing ------- 1. Since a new admin endpoint will be added with this proposal, need to update some unit tests with the new service information. 2. Add unit tests for new functionality introduced. Documentation Impact -------------------- Update api documentation to include admin/management API information. References ---------- [1] - Magnum admin API specification: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/magnum-admin-api [2] - Proposed change under review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391301/

commit_message:
Convert "convert_image.yml" task list to role

include_role module is still in preview, and using it inside block
statement, or in nested include gives problems. Calling the role
indirectly as a workaround.

Change-Id: I6b1cd68a2babcdbee14a6cc8674efa813dfa331b

commit_message:
Add unit test for extract_snapshot with compression enabled

Add a unit test for the libvirt.utils.extract_snapshot which sets
snapshot_compression option to True and verifies that qemu-img convert
is called with the -c option.

Closes-Bug: #1650770

Change-Id: I4d89e596ae79a329718bc22a774384ae723decb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/412485/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: qemu_img_cmd = ('qemu-img', 'convert', '-f', src_format, '-O', out_format) if CONF.libvirt.snapshot_compression and dest_format == "qcow2": qemu_img_cmd += ('-c',) qemu_img_cmd += ('/path/to/disk/image', '/extracted/snap') mock_execute.assert_called_once_with(*qemu_img_cmd) def test_extract_snapshot_qcow2_and_compression(self, mock_execute): self.flags(snapshot_compression=True, group='libvirt') self._do_test_extract_snapshot(mock_execute, dest_format='qcow2', out_format='qcow2') @mock.patch.object(utils, 'execute')
deleted_lines: mock_execute.assert_called_once_with( 'qemu-img', 'convert', '-f', src_format, '-O', out_format, '/path/to/disk/image', '/extracted/snap')

commit_message:
Disable legacy ceilometer api

Now that ceilometer api is deprecated, lets disable it
by default. You can still enable by setting the
enable_legacy_ceilometer_api param to true.

Change-Id: I9e77ed7d285c69d89aea1f62a098a25619c57420

commit_message:
Fix issues from new CentOS 7 release

This patch fixes the gate blocker for CentOS 7 in the Newton branch.

The grep for `rpmverify` needed an update to exclude `/var` and
`/etc`. Files in both directories are updated in the security role.

Also, the `yum-cron` packaging bug affects the Newton branch as well.
The workaround from master (I80b66a6d9e7c8ad97761a1f890ec6a3d2db88659)
is backported to Newton.

Change-Id: I9b0f77eceb32d18a0d07f53ff1dbac2117b29da4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/13/409913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mhayden): yum-cron has a bug upon update due to a RPM conflict in # the yum-cron.conf file. This test should be re-enabled when the # OpenStack CI images are updated. # See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1293513 security_unattended_upgrades_enabled: "{{ (ansible_os_family | lower == 'debian') | ternary(true, false) }}" security_unattended_upgrades_notifications: "{{ (ansible_os_family | lower == 'debian') | ternary(true, false) }}"
deleted_lines: security_unattended_upgrades_enabled: true security_unattended_upgrades_notifications: true

commit_message:
Copy map-services script to tripleo elements

map-services will be removed on dib v2 branch, but
tripleo still relies heavily on it. To prevent breakage,
copy the script to the internal element using it.
In the future, all elements will need to be migrated
to new svc-map, but it is a massive change.

Change-Id: I9f450de66044123ab07fa498b68f744d1029089a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/95/406895/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # dib-lint: disable=indent # Copyright 2012 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # Copyright 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from __future__ import print_function import os import sys # Manually maintained for brevity; consider making this compiled from # distromatch or other rich data sources. # TripleO service name on the left, Fedora/RHEL on the right. service_map = { 'apache2': 'httpd', 'ceilometer-api': 'openstack-ceilometer-api', 'ceilometer-agent-central': 'openstack-ceilometer-central', 'ceilometer-agent-compute': 'openstack-ceilometer-compute', 'ceilometer-agent-notification': 'openstack-ceilometer-notification', 'ceilometer-collector': 'openstack-ceilometer-collector', 'cinder-api': 'openstack-cinder-api', 'cinder-backup': 'openstack-cinder-backup', 'cinder-scheduler': 'openstack-cinder-scheduler', 'cinder-volume': 'openstack-cinder-volume', 'glance-api': 'openstack-glance-api', 'glance-reg': 'openstack-glance-registry', 'heat-api': 'openstack-heat-api', 'heat-api-cfn': 'openstack-heat-api-cfn', 'heat-api-cloudwatch': 'openstack-heat-api-cloudwatch', 'heat-engine': 'openstack-heat-engine', 'ironic-api': 'openstack-ironic-api', 'ironic-conductor': 'openstack-ironic-conductor', 'keystone': 'openstack-keystone', 'libvirt-bin': 'libvirtd', 'mysql': ['mysqld', 'mariadb'], 'nova-conductor': 'openstack-nova-conductor', 'nova-api': 'openstack-nova-api', 'nova-cert': 'openstack-nova-cert', 'nova-scheduler': 'openstack-nova-scheduler', 'nova-consoleauth': 'openstack-nova-consoleauth', 'nova-compute': 'openstack-nova-compute', 'nova-novncproxy': 'openstack-nova-novncproxy', 'openvswitch-switch': 'openvswitch', 'rsync': 'rsyncd', 'swift-proxy': 'openstack-swift-proxy', 'swift-account': 'openstack-swift-account', 'swift-account-auditor': 'openstack-swift-account-auditor', 'swift-account-reaper': 'openstack-swift-account-reaper', 'swift-account-replicator': 'openstack-swift-account-replicator', 'swift-container': 'openstack-swift-container', 'swift-container-auditor': 'openstack-swift-container-auditor', 'swift-container-replicator': 'openstack-swift-container-replicator', 'swift-container-updater': 'openstack-swift-container-updater', 'swift-object': 'openstack-swift-object', 'swift-object-auditor': 'openstack-swift-object-auditor', 'swift-object-replicator': 'openstack-swift-object-replicator', 'swift-object-updater': 'openstack-swift-object-updater', 'tgt': 'tgtd', } print("WARNING: map-services has been deprecated. " "Please use the svc-map element.", file=sys.stderr) for arg in sys.argv[1:]: # We need to support the service name being different when installing from # source vs. packages. So, if the requested service file already exists, # just use that. if os.path.exists('/lib/systemd/system/%s.service' % arg): print(arg) else: mapping = service_map.get(arg, arg) # Handle cases where a service may map to multiple names depending on # which specific distribution we're using. if isinstance(mapping, list): for name in mapping: if os.path.exists('/lib/systemd/system/%s.service' % name): print(name) break else: # We didn't find a match for any of the mappings. print(arg) else: print(mapping) sys.exit(0)

commit_message:
change os in command example to openstack(3)

In the current doc, the command examples are like
"os server create" but the acutal command should
be started with "openstack" instead of "os", it
is misleading to first time users.

Change-Id: Ie67c0152d8ff8b7c456f91dc8b9a9164437ee9d1

commit_message:
change os in command example to openstack(2)

In the current doc, the command examples are like
"os server create" but the acutal command should
be started with "openstack" instead of "os", it
is misleading to first time users.

Change-Id: I80c96f0938cec382f2f714a500138bd5a2c81aa0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/73/412673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack object store account set openstack object store account show openstack object store account unset
deleted_lines: os object store account set os object store account show os object store account unset

commit_message:
change os in command example to openstack

In the current doc, the command examples are like
"os server create" but the acutal command should
be started with "openstack" instead of "os", it
is misleading to first time users.

Change-Id: Ic7686257725e1aa8e4e0d65a712eff1c079927a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/69/412669/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack endpoint create openstack endpoint create openstack endpoint delete openstack endpoint list openstack endpoint set openstack endpoint show
deleted_lines: os endpoint create os endpoint create os endpoint delete os endpoint list os endpoint set os endpoint show

subject: Driver based model for kuryr-libnetwork
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-21 18:03:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/50a5fdad796c42fc0c6eb1658570566bedb98411', 'message': "[WIP]Driver based model for kuryr-libnetwork

This patch introduces drivers to preform deployment specific functions
for libnetwork. This patch is based on and complementary to the driver
model introduced in kuryr-lib for port binding, by enabling its use in
kuryr-libnetwork.

Initially the following two drivers will be available and included:
* veth: this driver will exclusively make use of the the corresponding
  kuryr-lib veth driver.
* nested: this driver is intended for nested containers and will enable
  the use of ipvlan/macvlan binding drivers.

The driver will be selected by means of a new 'port_driver' option.

TODO:
* unit tests
* coherency checks or different binding driver selection logic
* possible interface extension to include IPAM hooks
* update dangling port with master mac address
Implements: blueprint driver-binding-ipvlan

Change-Id: I380fb017dc97a2cd54a404ec3c8154ecc2df80b8

commit_message:
Driver based model for kuryr-libnetwork

This patch introduces drivers to perform deployment specific functions
for libnetwork. This patch is based on and complementary to the driver
model introduced in kuryr-lib for port binding, by enabling its use in
kuryr-libnetwork.

Initially the following two drivers will be available and included:
* veth: this driver will exclusively make use of the the corresponding
  kuryr-lib veth driver.
* nested: this driver is intended for nested containers and will enable
  the use of ipvlan/macvlan binding drivers.

The driver will be selected by means of a new 'port_driver' option.

NOTE: Due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/kuryr-libnetwork/+bug/1651015
When trying nested ports, it is important to use Kuryr to create the
networks that will be used by Nova to create the instances, otherwise
the nested ports will not be able to be cleaned.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Luis Tomas Bolivar <ltomasbo@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Louise Daly <louise.m.daly@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gary Loughnane <gary.loughnane@intel.com>
Implements: blueprint driver-binding-ipvlan

Change-Id: I380fb017dc97a2cd54a404ec3c8154ecc2df80b8

commit_message:
Update vmware_nsxlib version to 0.5.0

The version contains the following bug fixes:
1. Bug fix for DHCP. This ensures that a instance gets the correct default
   gateway.

The version also adds new API's supporting IPAM.

Change-Id: I8a34ab330796157489708b1b9e2f7191c89112af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/12/413012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Create directories with root

Depending on the specified paths, stack user does not
have enough perms to create it. Create the directories
with become: true, but add right ownership and permissions.

Change-Id: Ic43d295d901d0c1d4bd9bad49d505e63433ecfe8

added_lines: owner: "{{ ansible_env.USER }}" mode: 0775 become: true

commit_message:
Fix image meta-data update for Glance v2

This patch fixes the following issues with Glance v2 image meta-
data update:

* Glance v2 doesn't support updating image size. The size will
be set by the glance service and there is no need to update it.

* We need to convert the image version to string before update
because Glance v2 doesn't support integer values for properties.

This patch also deprecates the image version kwarg because it is
not used by VMware drivers.

Change-Id: I0da5958cbde8be2008ee00602e6e9561bf167bfd
Closes-bug: #1611288

Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85 removes this class variable
because we thought no one was using it anymore. We were wrong and broke
some Tempest plugins. But this variable shouldn"t have been used in the

commit_message:
Clients.py: add back the default_params_with_timeout_values class variable

Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85 removes this class variable
because we thought no one was using it anymore. We were wrong and broke
some Tempest plugins. But this variable shouldn"t have been used in the
first place because it's a private/internal variable only. So we
expect plugins will eventually remove their dependency on that var.

Change-Id: Iac926f12cf3a1681a596f0ba7d014a402cda5fa0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/11/412511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(jordanP): remove this once no Tempest plugin use that class # variable. default_params_with_timeout_values = { 'build_interval': CONF.compute.build_interval, 'build_timeout': CONF.compute.build_timeout } default_params_with_timeout_values.update(default_params)

commit_message:
Add functional tests for B308, B321, and B402

Several checks lack any functional test as described in the bug.
This patch adds mark_safe and ftplib tests.

There was also a typo in the calls doc where mark_safe was listed
under httpsconnection.

Also, the mark_safe check wasn't working because the full import
path for the call was not specified. That was also corrected.

Change-Id: I6f35fb65cb8c25a474175de99fcac04ea2b7d81e
Closes-Bug: #1648257

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/49/49/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def service_request(self, version='2.0', path='', port=5000, headers=None, **kwargs): path = KeystoneTestCase._version_path(version, path) def admin_request(self, version='2.0', path='', port=5001, headers=None, **kwargs): path = KeystoneTestCase._version_path(version, path) def _version_path(version, path): """Prepend the given path with the API version. An empty version results in no version being prepended.""" if version: return '/v' + str(version) + str(path) else: return str(path)
deleted_lines: def service_request(self, path='', port=5000, headers=None, **kwargs): path = KeystoneTestCase._prepend_path(path) def admin_request(self, path='', port=5001, headers=None, **kwargs): path = KeystoneTestCase._prepend_path(path) def _prepend_path(path): """Prepend the given path with the API version""" return '/v2.0' + str(path)

commit_message:
Typo in calls doc for input call

The ftplib has nothing to do with the input() call. Replacing this
with the proper name of 'input'.

Change-Id: Ie9b2560a4af3770da559b63a59e8e85d903bf94c
Closes-Bug: #1648261

commit_message:
Handle curve keyword arg weak_cryptographic_key

The weak_cryptographic_key check was missing the handling of a
curve keyword argument.

commit_message:
Support multiple uuids and names for RP list

In case we want to get a list of ResourceProviders using more than one name
or uuid, we need to add to the REST API the possibility by adding an 'in:'
prefix to the attribute.

Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-providers-get-by-request

Change-Id: I58b67f76913bb40e319231ef981331fcca62d486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/407630/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_all_by_filters_multiple_names_or_uuids(self): for rp_i in ['1', '2']: uuid = getattr(uuidsentinel, 'rp_uuid_' + rp_i) name = 'rp_name_' + rp_i rp = objects.ResourceProvider(self.context, name=name, uuid=uuid) rp.create() resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'name': ['rp_name_1']}) self.assertEqual(1, len(resource_providers)) resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'name': ['rp_name_1', 'rp_name_2']}) self.assertEqual(2, len(resource_providers)) resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'uuid': [getattr(uuidsentinel, 'rp_uuid_2'), getattr(uuidsentinel, 'rp_uuid_1')]}) self.assertEqual(2, len(resource_providers))

commit_message:
[Docs] Exceptions for user init files

Making broad changes to user initialization files with Ansible is
disruptive to the contents of home directories. This patch contains
documentation for exceptions.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ia9d2cb336ab2a9f7af7baec644d3b04535f498e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/36/408736/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: "Find initialization files in {{ user.dir }} for {{ user.name }}" find: paths: "{{ user.dir }}" patterns: '^\..*' hidden: yes use_regex: yes register: user_initialization_files tags: - medium - file_perms - RHEL-07-020840 - RHEL-07-020850 - RHEL-07-020860 - name: "Set owner, group owner, and modes on initialization files for {{ user.name }}" file: path: "{{ item.path }}" owner: "{{ user.name }}" group: "{{ user.group.name }}" mode: "u-X,g-wxs,o-rwxt" with_items: "{{ user_initialization_files.files }}" when: - not user_initialization_files | skipped - security_set_user_initialization_files_owners_permissions | bool tags: - medium - file_perms - RHEL-07-020840 - RHEL-07-020850 - RHEL-07-020860

commit_message:
Remove checking for special characters in shells

This commit removes our logic that checks for special characters
in shell injection tests.  Really, all we care about is whether
format string characters are being used - if so we're probably
taking some kind of user input.  If not, it doesn't matter
whether we're calling something with special characters.

Change-Id: I7e6a8c45a25608e3a8ab8a7eca8d8f2de5dd9837
Closes-Bug: #1650393

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove bandit.

Change-Id: Id9826953ea4f63702af427c0170c235afb91abaf

commit_message:
[Docs] Update for RHEL7 STIG

This patch updates the controls documentation for RHEL 7 and also adds a
reference to the RHEL 7 STIG content in the main documentation page.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I56bd97dc793dddea7e05c0ac20a6579e7cfec533
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/58/410258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The openstack-ansible-security role follows the Red Hat Enteprise Linux 7 `Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG)`_. The guide has over 200 controls that apply to various parts of a Linux system and it is updated regularly by the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA). DISA is part of the United States Department of Defense. The current version of the openstack- ansible-security role is based on release 1, version 0.2 of the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 STIG. Controls are divided into groups based on certain properties: * **Severity:** * *High severity* controls have a large impact on the security of a system. They also have the largest operational impact to a system and each should be tested thoroughly in non-production environments. * *Low severity* controls have a smaller impact on overall security, but they are generally easier to implement with a much lower operational impact. * **Implementation Status:** * *Implemented* controls are automatically implemented with automated tasks. Deployers can often opt out of these controls by adjusting Ansible variables. These variables are documented with each control below. * *Exceptions* denote controls that cannot be completed via automated tasks. Some of these controls must be done during the initial provisioning process for new servers while others require manual inspection of the system. * *Opt in* controls have automated tasks written, but these tasks are disabled by default. These controls are often disabled because they could cause disruptions on a production system or they do not provide a significant security benefit. Each control can be enabled with Ansible variables and these variables are documented with each control below. * *Verification only* controls have tasks that verify that a control is met. These tasks do not take any action on the system, but they often display debug output with additional instructions for deployers. * **Tag:** * Each control has a tag applied and the tags allow deployers to select specific groups of controls to apply. For example, deployers can apply the controls for the ssh daemon by using ``--tags sshd`` on the Ansible command line. * Tags also make it easier to navigate through the Ansible tasks in the code itself. For example, all tasks tagged with ``auditd`` are found within ``tasks/rhel7stig/auditd.yml``. .. _Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG): http://iase.disa.mil/stigs/os/unix-linux/Pages/red-hat.aspx Although the STIG is specific to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, it applies well to CentOS 7 systems. In addition, almost all of the controls are easily translated for Ubuntu 16.04. Any deviations during translation are noted within the documentation below. .. note:: The RHEL 7 STIG content is still under development and is disabled by default. Deployers can test the tasks on non-production systems by setting the ``stig_version`` variable on the Ansible command line: .. code-block:: console ansible-playbook -i hosts playbook.yml -e stig_version=rhel7
deleted_lines: RHEL 7 STIG controls are still in development

commit_message:
Use Ironic Inspector tempest plugin from master

Fetch master to install the plugin if a patch isn't against
master. And on master, use the local change to pick up any
changes to the plugin.
Ironic is doing this already.

Otherwise it could have side effect when tempest breaks Inspector
grenade, where we need to fix tempest plugin for both branches.
And it's hard to do with voting grenade job
I2660fda0c5aeca656be5c7b565f2e0bf255658f1.

Also fix ironic's version of this to append to TEMPEST_PLUGINS instead
of clobbering it.

Change-Id: I547650f221f481d28931af8e4a45daf17aa3f765
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/77/412477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # use tempest plugin if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "master" ]] ; then # NOTE(jroll) if this isn't a patch against master, then # fetch master to install the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS=git+git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector" else # on master, use the local change, so we can pick up any changes to the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' /opt/stack/new/ironic-inspector'" fi
deleted_lines: export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS+=' /opt/stack/new/ironic-inspector'"

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove hacking.

Change-Id: Id01984f5a986cf84a8fff3f028bb6246364ea2ff

subject: Update OSSA-2016-012 to with versioning note
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 17:36:07.000000000', 'files': ['ossa/OSSA-2016-012.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ossa/commit/843d1f606fadb745d7cc78eb48d7d734a492fe39', 'message': "Update OSSA-2016-012 to with versioning note

As Glance planned it's final liberty release, a stable maintainer found
that the patch for OSSA-2016-012 could potentially break if the
deployment did not have oslo.concurrency 2.6.1 or newer. The minimum
version on liberty branches, however, is 2.3.0. Glance has updated it's
fix to allow for the older version while logging an error for operators
to upgrade (Iff51c59041e23fa158f7939891c46e9a150883fc).

To document this to it's fullest extent, we have updated the notes to
explain the necessity of the version bump in oslo.concurrency even
though the stable maintenance team and requirements teams agreed to not
bump the lower limit globally after this CVE was found.

Change-Id: I85c28168ad4a7726f8334f3d1ce98c6194dd7cb0
"}]
commit_message:
Update OSSA-2016-012 to with versioning note

As Glance planned it's final liberty release, a stable maintainer found
that the patch for OSSA-2016-012 could potentially break if the
deployment did not have oslo.concurrency 2.6.1 or newer. The minimum
version on liberty branches, however, is 2.3.0. Glance has updated it's
fix to allow for the older version while logging an error for operators
to upgrade (Iff51c59041e23fa158f7939891c46e9a150883fc).

To document this to it's fullest extent, we have updated the notes to
explain the necessity of the version bump in oslo.concurrency even
though the stable maintenance team and requirements teams agreed to not
bump the lower limit globally after this CVE was found.

Change-Id: I85c28168ad4a7726f8334f3d1ce98c6194dd7cb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ossa refs/changes/32/408232/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - > The minimum allowed version of oslo.concurrency for the Glance 11.0.x and Nova 12.0.x is 2.3.0 but that version does not contain the necessary feature to prevent this attack. Users are expected to upgrade to oslo.concurrency 2.6.1 as well as the versions of those services specified above.

commit_message:
Settings for test cases

This patch adds a function to configure the settings for test cases. It
currently sets the needed settings for the first federation scenario
test (follow up patch). If needed, additional settings can be added.

Change-Id: I5f0d0b5eeee1d8f03b38a2eb4cdc2101d3dccaa1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/05/410205/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DOMAIN_NAME=${DOMAIN_NAME:-federated_domain} PROJECT_NAME=${PROJECT_NAME:-federated_project} GROUP_NAME=${GROUP_NAME:-federated_users} # TODO(rodrigods): remove/update the settings based at testshibIDP_USERNAME=${IDP_USERNAME:-myself} IDP_PASSWORD=${IDP_PASSWORD:-myself} IDP_REMOTE_ID=${IDP_REMOTE_ID:-https://idp.testshib.org/idp/shibboleth} IDP_ECP_URL=${IDP_ECP_URL:-https://idp.testshib.org/idp/profile/SAML2/SOAP/ECP} MAPPING_REMOTE_TYPE=${MAPPING_REMOTE_TYPE:-eppn} MAPPING_USER_NAME=${MAPPING_REMOTE_TYPE:-{0}} PROTOCOL_ID=${PROTOCOL_ID:-mapped}function set_tests_settings { # Here we set any settings that might be need by the fed-scenario set of tests iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity-feature-enabled federation True # Identity provider settings iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario idp_id $IDP_ID iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario idp_remote_ids $IDP_REMOTE_ID iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario idp_username $IDP_USERNAME iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario idp_password $IDP_PASSWORD iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario idp_ecp_url $IDP_ECP_URL # Mapping rules settings iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario mapping_remote_type $MAPPING_REMOTE_TYPE iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario mapping_user_name $MAPPING_USER_NAME iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario mapping_group_name $GROUP_NAME iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario mapping_group_domain_name $DOMAIN_NAME # Protocol settings iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG fed-scenario protocol_id $PROTOCOL_ID } function register_federation { local federated_domain=$(get_or_create_domain $DOMAIN_NAME) local federated_project=$(get_or_create_project $PROJECT_NAME $DOMAIN_NAME) local federated_users=$(get_or_create_group $GROUP_NAME $DOMAIN_NAME) set_tests_settings
deleted_lines: function register_federation { local federated_domain=$(get_or_create_domain federated_domain) local federated_project=$(get_or_create_project federated_project federated_domain) local federated_users=$(get_or_create_group federated_users federated_domain)

commit_message:
Fix Cinder commands

This change forces the use of Bash when running the cinder client. This
is required because the command starts with 'source keystonerc' which is
Bash-specific.

Change-Id: I6e720a6b666772357842729dc95ebc5ef6301c39

commit_message:
Move UpgradeInitCommand to role templates

We can't run this during the upgrade steps, because there are things
which need to happen before any role configuration happens, e.g
installing the new hiera heat-config hook, which must be done before
e.g "ControllerDeployment" runs or the stack update hangs.

Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service
Change-Id: I365b57513590662c3f78a33dc625747f457c48c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/10/411310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
UpgradeInitCommand: type: string description: | Command or script snippet to run on all overcloud nodes to initialize the upgrade process. E.g. a repository switch. default: '' ControllerUpgradeInitConfig: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script config: config: list_join: - '' - - "#!/bin/bash

" - "if [[ -f /etc/resolv.conf.save ]] ; then rm /etc/resolv.conf.save; fi

" - get_param: UpgradeInitCommand # Note we may be able to make this conditional on UpgradeInitCommandNotEmpty # but https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1649900 needs fixing first ControllerUpgradeInitDeployment: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment depends_on: NetworkDeployment properties: name: ControllerUpgradeInitDeployment server: {get_resource: Controller} config: {get_resource: ControllerUpgradeInitConfig} depends_on: ControllerUpgradeInitDeployment
deleted_lines: depends_on: NetworkDeployment

subject: Run upgrade steps before post-deploy config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 16:42:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/6c1f70e74272d664351b7ccf81a94cfdc1c3c1d6', 'message': 'Run upgrade steps before post-deploy config

For some upgrade scenarios, e.g all-in-one deployments, it may
be possible to run the upgrade steps, then apply puppet in one
stack update, so reverse the order here.  For normal deployments
the upgrade steps are mapped to OS::Heat::None so this will have
no effect.

Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service
Change-Id: I3c78751349a6ac2bc5dff82f67bffe13750ac21c

'}]
commit_message:
Run upgrade steps before post-deploy config

For some upgrade scenarios, e.g all-in-one deployments, it may
be possible to run the upgrade steps, then apply puppet in one
stack update, so reverse the order here.  For normal deployments
the upgrade steps are mapped to OS::Heat::None so this will have
no effect.

Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service
Change-Id: I3c78751349a6ac2bc5dff82f67bffe13750ac21c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/57/409857/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We run the upgrade steps without disabling the OS::TripleO::PostDeploySteps # this means you can do a major upgrade in one pass, which may be useful # e.g for all-in-one deployments where we can upgrade the compute services # at the same time as the controlplane # Note that it will be necessary to pass a mapping of OS::Heat::None again for # any subsequent updates, or the upgrade steps will run again. resource_registry: OS::TripleO::UpgradeSteps: ../puppet/major_upgrade_steps.yaml

commit_message:
Add tripleo-validations user documentation

This describes what the validations are for and how and when to run
them.

Change-Id: I13a52b02a2ae2b3f2c971531e267c3c33ffdac2b

added_lines: .. admonition:: Validations Once the undercloud is installed, you can run the ``pre-introspection`` validations: :: mistral execution-create tripleo.validations.v1.run_groups '{"group_names": ["pre-introspection"]}' Then verify the results as described in: :ref:`Running a group of validations` .. admonition:: Validations Before you start the deployment, you may want to run the ``pre-deployment`` validations: :: mistral execution-create tripleo.validations.v1.run_groups '{"group_names": ["pre-deployment"]}' Then verify the results as described in: :ref:`Running a group of validations` Run the post-deployment validations ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Before you start the deployment, you may want to run the ``post-deployment`` validations: :: mistral execution-create tripleo.validations.v1.run_groups '{"group_names": ["post-deployment"]}' Then verify the results as described in: :ref:`Running a group of validations`

subject: Modify memory calculation formula for MySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 12:12:16.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/database/database.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/09ea28e73d656c3da56eac993e3395b5f3944c05', 'message': "Modify memory calculation formula for MySQL

- Optimize memory calculation formula. From one hand we want to limit
  MySQL to allocate not more than 50% of RAM. From other hand we want to
  have 1024 or greater connections. So, if environment has 2GB MySQL
  will allocate 1720Mb, if environment has 3 GB it will allocate 1984Mb
  of RAM. It will allocate 50% of RAM if server has 4.5+ GB. The higher
  limit will have action if server has 37+GB. In that case MySQL will
  allocate less than 50% of RAM.
- Pass key_buffer_size in megabytes rather than bytes.
- Remove query_cache_type, query_cache_type from fuel_override_options
  hash, as these settings are galera specific, so they should be
  explicitly in wsrep_options hash
- Remove myisam_sort_buffer_size. OpenStack services use InnoDB engine,
  so MyISAM optimazation should be disabled. The only DB which uses
  MyISAM is 'mysql'. The default value 8M is enough

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1648766

Change-Id: Ia48f94936fcd3090208e4e485d7c9cbfea3c0ed4
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Modify memory calculation formula for MySQL

- Optimize memory calculation formula. From one hand we want to limit
  MySQL to allocate not more than 50% of RAM. From other hand we want to
  have 1024 or greater connections. So, if environment has 2GB MySQL
  will allocate 1720Mb, if environment has 3 GB it will allocate 1984Mb
  of RAM. It will allocate 50% of RAM if server has 4.5+ GB. The higher
  limit will have action if server has 37+GB. In that case MySQL will
  allocate less than 50% of RAM.
- Pass key_buffer_size in megabytes rather than bytes.
- Remove query_cache_type, query_cache_type from fuel_override_options
  hash, as these settings are galera specific, so they should be
  explicitly in wsrep_options hash
- Remove myisam_sort_buffer_size. OpenStack services use InnoDB engine,
  so MyISAM optimazation should be disabled. The only DB which uses
  MyISAM is 'mysql'. The default value 8M is enough

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1648766

Change-Id: Ia48f94936fcd3090208e4e485d7c9cbfea3c0ed4
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/31/412431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $innodb_buffer_pool_size = inline_template("<%= [(${::memorysize_mb} * 0.25).floor, 8192].min %>") $innodb_log_file_size = inline_template("<%= [(${innodb_buffer_pool_size} * 0.2).floor, 2047].min %>") #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/innodb-parameters.html#sysvar_innodb_log_buffer_size $innodb_log_buffer_size = '8' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_key_buffer_size $key_buffer_size = '8' #Disabled for galera $query_cache_size = '0' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_tmp_table_size $tmp_table_size = '16' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_read_buffer_size $read_buffer_size = '0.125' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_read_rnd_buffer_size $read_rnd_buffer_size = '0.25' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_sort_buffer_size $sort_buffer_size = '0.25' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_join_buffer_size $join_buffer_size = '0.25' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/replication-options-binary-log.html#sysvar_binlog_cache_size $binlog_cache_size = '0.03125' #http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_thread_stack $thread_stack = '0.25' $max_connections = inline_template("<%= [[((${::memorysize_mb} * 0.25 - ${key_buffer_size} - ${query_cache_size} - ${tmp_table_size} - ${innodb_log_buffer_size} ) / (${read_buffer_size} + ${read_rnd_buffer_size} + ${sort_buffer_size} + ${join_buffer_size} + ${binlog_cache_size} + ${thread_stack})).floor, 8192].min, 1024].max %>") 'key_buffer_size' => "${key_buffer_size}M",
deleted_lines: $innodb_buffer_pool_size = inline_template("<%= [(${::memorysize_mb} * 0.2 + 0).floor, 10000].min %>") $innodb_log_file_size = inline_template("<%= [(${innodb_buffer_pool_size} * 0.2 + 0).floor, 2047].min %>") $key_buffer_size = 64 $sort_buffer_size_mb = '0.25' $read_buffer_size_mb = '0.125' $max_connections = inline_template( "<%= [[((${::memorysize_mb} * 0.3 - ${key_buffer_size}) / (${sort_buffer_size_mb} + ${read_buffer_size_mb})).floor, 8192].min, 2048].max %>") 'myisam_sort_buffer_size' => '64M', 'key_buffer_size' => $key_buffer_size, 'query_cache_size' => '0', 'query_cache_type' => '0',

commit_message:
Allow multiple devstack Cinder plugins

This commit allows this plugin to be run in parallel with other devstack plugins
like glusterfs, ceph, etc. This is needed to allow gate jobs that test
multibackend features.

Change-Id: I79c5ee753607953ffad7e78b96ffea506d84fc21

subject: Enable filtering for Cinder LVM volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 15:45:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/14b64f3f456d545b8861807a0cf4ede63ed3564b', 'message': "Enable filtering for Cinder LVM volumes

commit_message:
Enable filtering for Cinder LVM volumes

Currently the default behavior of LVM is
to scan all available block devices in
/dev folder, this leads to issues on environments
with Cinder LVM volumes. Guest's volumes are recognized
by parent host's OS and are scanned by LVM. If guest's
volume contains LVM inside, it is also detected by
parent host's OS. Such volumes can not be
deleted.

This patch modifies LVM filter on Cinder node in
order to exclude LVs present in Cinder volume group
from LVM scan. During testing it was found that
initramds should be updated upon changing of
filtering rules.

Closes-Bug: #1645624

Change-Id: I49e286e92095259e0196b6dd49dc10da0ebb4c20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/41/409841/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $cinder_lvm_filter = "\"r|^/dev/${volume_group}/.*|\"" augeas { 'lvm-conf-set-cinder-filter': context => '/files/etc/lvm/lvm.conf/devices/dict/', changes => "set global_filter/list/1/str ${cinder_lvm_filter}", tag => 'lvm-conf-augeas' } exec { 'Update initramfs': command => 'update-initramfs -u -k all', path => '/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin' } Augeas<| tag == 'lvm-conf-augeas'|> ~> Exec<| title == 'Update initramfs' |>

subject: Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 17:07:01.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent/commit/e19d61d875953034bb396d006084af64bbdd380c', 'message': "Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
instead of simply restarting mcollective.

Change-Id: I43e1ec46bf145ebcf23d044c7a6f08f2b60542d9
Partial-bug: #1642377
(cherry picked from commit 94633af411c6692f98c44337d30a4af031176430)
"}]
commit_message:
Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
instead of simply restarting mcollective.

Change-Id: I43e1ec46bf145ebcf23d044c7a6f08f2b60542d9
Partial-bug: #1642377
(cherry picked from commit 94633af411c6692f98c44337d30a4af031176430)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent refs/changes/53/401353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: puts `/usr/bin/fix-configs-on-startup`
deleted_lines: puts `service mcollective restart`

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 11:27:51.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/aodh/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/glance/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/murano/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-controller/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/heat/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/keystone/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-network/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/ironic/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/sahara/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-cinder/tasks.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/139c5f4fadd45c3d1430c38b6a3c7238612d4211', 'message': "Fix dependency issues between tasks

DB tasks should wait for galera explicitly. There shouldn't be
conditions when primary-database is done, allowing *-db tasks to create
users while galera is syncing with other nodes. That causes split brain
as *-db tasks create users in MyISAM tables which is not handled by
Galera.

Closes-Bug: #1636841
Change-Id: I729ba0f2bfce1e731de36c932f5f0350e91adb22
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix dependency issues between tasks

DB tasks should wait for galera explicitly. There shouldn't be
conditions when primary-database is done, allowing *-db tasks to create
users while galera is syncing with other nodes. That causes split brain
as *-db tasks create users in MyISAM tables which is not handled by
Galera.

Closes-Bug: #1636841
Change-Id: I729ba0f2bfce1e731de36c932f5f0350e91adb22
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Use ``enabled_backends`` option to set up backends

1) Configurations that are setting backend config in ``[DEFAULT]``
   section are now not supported. We should use ``enabled_backends``
   option to set up backends. No volume service(s) started successfully
   otherwise.
2) Fix breaker ci

Change-Id: Id211cf6bb82b39cb71f018a2a3f33de0a288ddc7
Closes-Bug: #1650713
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/50/412050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - Configurations that are setting backend config in ``[DEFAULT]`` section are now not supported. You should use ``enabled_backends`` option to set up backends. No volume service(s) started successfully otherwise.

commit_message:
Improve bifrost inventory module

- Attempt to load both JSON and YAML formats with YAML parser.
  JSON is a strict subset of YAML, and any valid JSON must be parsable
  by YAML parser.
- yaml.load is not gerenally safe. Since the data source is a simple data
  structure lets be more strict and use yaml.safe_load instead.
- Do not continue working with parsed data while the file is still open,
  exit the open file context manager as soon as file is parsed.

Change-Id: Ic617e886fd7d1d35b784ee40d836921332ecca1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/35/409135/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: file_data = json.load(file_object) except Exception as e: LOG.debug("Attempting to parse JSON: %s" % e) try: file_object.seek(0) file_data = yaml.load(file_object) except Exception as e: LOG.debug("Attempting to parse YAML: %s" % e) raise Exception("Failed to parse JSON and YAML") for name in file_data: host = file_data[name] # Perform basic validation if ('ipv4_address' not in host or not host['ipv4_address']): host['addressing_mode'] = "dhcp" else: host['ansible_ssh_host'] = host['ipv4_address'] if ('provisioning_ipv4_address' not in host and 'addressing_mode' not in host): host['provisioning_ipv4_address'] = host['ipv4_address'] # Add each host to the values to be returned. groups['baremetal']['hosts'].append(host['name']) hostvars.update({host['name']: host})

commit_message:
Use ephemeral=0 to create flavor without ephemeral disk

When creating flavor, whether <"ephemeral": 0> is included
in request body will get same results <"OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral": 0>,
so we needn't use different code to create flavor with or without
ephemeral disk.
Besides, it seems not necessary to use different flavor names for
flavor with or without ephemeral disk, the info can easily be got
from flavor info. So the code can become more simple.

Change-Id: If0a63ff401f34caebff00b7925b08fe02b3eb5d3

deleted_lines: flavor_with_eph_disk_id = data_utils.rand_int_id(start=1000) if ephem_disk > 0: # Create a flavor with ephemeral disk flavor_name = data_utils.rand_name('eph_flavor') flavor = self.flavor_client.create_flavor( name=flavor_name, ram=ram, vcpus=vcpus, disk=disk, id=flavor_with_eph_disk_id, ephemeral=ephem_disk)['flavor'] else: # Create a flavor without ephemeral disk flavor_name = data_utils.rand_name('no_eph_flavor') flavor = self.flavor_client.create_flavor( name=flavor_name, ram=ram, vcpus=vcpus, disk=disk, id=flavor_with_eph_disk_id)['flavor']
