commit_message:
Configure DPDK options to isolate PMD cores and ovs process cores

The parameter -l in DPDK_OPTIONS is applied to both list cores to be
used by PMD and the list of cores that all the OVS threads should run
on. This will impact the DPDK performance, as cores on which PMD are
running, should be completely isolated (no other process should) use
it. For this, we are configuring, -l option with list of host cpus and
the list PMD cores will be configured using ovs-vsctl config command.

Fixes-Bug: #1649836

Change-Id: Ib95281bcbde34c18d26ee11d4e2603b267db563b

added_lines: # [*host_core_list*] # (required) The list of host cores to be used by the DPDK Poll Mode Driver # The host_core_list is a string with format as <c1>[-c2][,c3[-c4],...] where c1, c2, etc are core indexes between 0 and 128 # For example, to configure 3 cores the value should be "0-2" # # [*pmd_core_list*] # (required) The list of cores to be used by the OVS Agent # The pmd_core_list is a string with format as <c1>[-c2][,c3[-c4],...] where c1, c2, etc are core indexes between 0 and 128# DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*core_list*] # (optional) Deprecated. # The list of cores to be used by the DPDK Poll Mode Driver # The core_list is a string with format as <c1>[-c2][,c3[-c4],...] where c1, c2, etc are core indexes between 0 and 128 # For example, to configure 3 cores the value should be "0-2" # Defaults to undef. # $host_core_list = undef, $pmd_core_list = undef, # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $core_list = undef, if $host_core_list { $core_list_string = $host_core_list } elsif $core_list { warning('core_list is deprecated, will be used when host_core_list is not defined and will be removed in a future release.') $core_list_string = $core_list } else { fail('either host core list or core list must be set for ovs agent when DPDK is enabled') } $options = "DPDK_OPTIONS = \"-l ${core_list_string} -n ${memory_channels} ${socket_string} ${white_list}\"" if $pmd_core_list { $pmd_core_list_updated = inline_template('<%= @pmd_core_list.split(",").map{|c| c.include?("-")?(c.split("-").map(&:to_i)[0]..c.split("-").map(&:to_i)[1]).to_a.join(","):c}.join(",") %>') $pmd_core_mask = inline_template('<%= @pmd_core_list_updated.split(",").map{|c| 1<<c.to_i}.inject(0,:|).to_s(16) %>') vs_config { 'other_config:pmd-cpu-mask': value => $pmd_core_mask, require => Package[$::vswitch::params::ovs_dpdk_package_name], before => Service['openvswitch'], } } before => Service['openvswitch'],
deleted_lines: # [*core_list*] # (required) The list of cores to be used by the DPDK Poll Mode Driver # The core_list is a string with format as <c1>[-c2][,c3[-c4],...] where c1, c2, etc are core indexes between 0 and 128 $core_list, $options = "DPDK_OPTIONS = \"-l ${core_list} -n ${memory_channels} ${socket_string} ${white_list}\"" before => Service['openvswitch']

commit_message:
move release step for updating constraints to after the PyPI upload

We have a race condition in the jobs for patches to
openstack/requirements submitted by the release jobs because the
packages are not yet on PyPI when the patch is proposed to update the
constraints file. This change moves the constraint update portion of the
release job to a separate job and schedules it to run as a dependency of
the PyPI upload job.

Change-Id: Idce73ca3813858050e8f64ece44e838266aaf5d6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

VERSION=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | cut -f3 -d/) /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/release-tools/update_constraints.sh $VERSION publishers: - test-results - console-log

workflows. We need to test this feature so, let's add the CI job in
puppet-mistral.

safe for our slower clouds.

commit_message:
increasing tempest job timeout congress

Ever so often the devstack setup (independent of Congress) takes
10+ min longer than usual to complete, leading to the job timing
out right around the end of the tests, causing extra work for
infra resource and people to do rechecks.

This patch sets a somewhat longer time limit for avoid the issue.

Change-Id: I03ddc3a1ccfb26c2315453d81888170198e9a3fb

commit_message:
Merge diskimage-builder and shade nodepool-dsvm jobs

Since both jobs were doing this same thing, we can merge them into a
single nodepool dsvm src job.  This will allow us to also include
things like glean in a future patch.

Change-Id: I5eb37f5660f6eabec103df0ed719c3d431b681e1
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Code review changes

Change-Id: I99ab0a12ca8ba5c4161fce5d09430acac3d0a447
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/39/412639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Proposing generic image partition approach1631622-unable-to-create-partition-for-storageImportant Note: the suggesetd implementation was already done and tested in liberty base code. This code was not pushed upstream but is part of an openstack based on liberty with osp director (redhats) and being in use as part of nokia's infrastruture for cloud. We will merge this code to master stream for this blueprint, inorder to avoid merging for later releases.(i think this is redhat's utility) to create a Full disk with partitions and First i have tested the new code heavily making sure behaiviour does not change if layout property is not set and irnoic maintance the same functionality and deploys the same disk partition as it is without setting the property. i also comapred results with earlier versions that do not have the new code. Updated the following tests in the following files to cover all exsiting test cases, and added some more tests:
deleted_lines: Generic image partition aproach* If you do not wish to submit a complete spec (for example, you do not plan to complete the spec during this cycle but would like to document the idea) you can submit a short spec. commit_message:
Add filtering 'status' and 'project' options to floating ip list

This patch adds filtering '--status' and '--project' options and
also adds '--long' option to floating ip list command.

Change-Id: Ibc5910d87ce60adbe2045ad894c3e82384fa9723
Co-Authored-By: Ha Van Tu <tuhv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint network-commands-options
Closes-Bug: #1614379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/74/357574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [--long] [--project <project>] [--status <status>] .. option:: --long List additional fields in output .. option:: --project <project> List floating IP according to their project (name or ID) .. option:: --status <status> List floating IPs according to their status (ACTIVE or DOWN)

commit_message:
Use self.xx_client instead of self.os.xx_client in testcases

Since there ready exists self.xx_client definitions in base.py,
so in testcases self.xx_client should be used instead of
self.os.xx_client

Change-Id: I9cefdbffe346dc3c551a9b418c634f7ed28b5e19

commit_message:
NOMERGE: DEBUG MITAKA BRANCH

Change-Id: Ib8d436021bea0539078d61bd1f1916c61896b82b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/59/412459/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -o errexit set -o xtrace function collect_logs { set +o errexit mkdir -p logs # copy system log sudo cp -r /var/log logs/system_log if which journalctl ; then # the journal gives us syslog() and kernel output, so is like # a concatenation of the above. sudo journalctl --no-pager | sudo tee logs/syslog.txt > /dev/null sudo journalctl --no-pager -u docker.service | sudo tee logs/docker.log > /dev/null else # assume rsyslog sudo cp /var/log/syslog logs/syslog.txt sudo cp /var/log/kern.log logs/kern_log.txt sudo cp /var/log/upstart/docker.log logs/docker.log fi if [[ -d /var/lib/docker/volumes/kolla_logs/_data ]]; then sudo cp -r /var/lib/docker/volumes/kolla_logs/_data logs/kolla_logs fi # sudo config sudo cp -r /etc/sudoers.d logs/ sudo cp /etc/sudoers logs/sudoers.txt df -h > logs/df.txt free > logs/free.txt sudo parted -l | sudo tee logs/parted-l.txt > /dev/null mount > logs/mount.txt env > logs/env.txt if [ `command -v dpkg` ]; then dpkg -l | sudo tee logs/dpkg-l.txt > /dev/null fi if [ `command -v rpm` ]; then rpm -qa | sudo tee logs/rpm-qa.txt > /dev/null fi # final memory usage and process list ps -eo user,pid,ppid,lwp,%cpu,%mem,size,rss,cmd > logs/ps.txt # docker related information (docker info && docker images && docker ps -a) > logs/docker-info.txt sudo cp -r /etc/kolla logs/kolla_configs # fix the permissions for logs folder sudo chmod -R 777 logs # rename files to .txt; this is so that when displayed via # logs.openstack.org clicking results in the browser shows the # files, rather than trying to send it to another app or make you # download it, etc. # firstly, rename all .log files to .txt files for f in $(find logs -name "*.log"); do sudo mv $f ${f/.log/.txt} done # append .txt to all kolla config file find logs/kolla_configs -type -f -exec mv '{}' '{}'.txt \; # Compress all text logs find logs -iname '*.txt' -execdir gzip -9 {} \+ find logs -iname '*.json' -execdir gzip -9 {} \+ set -o errexit } trap collect_logs EXIT

commit_message:
Release resource lock when executing reset_stack_status

The heat cmd "heat-manage reset_stack_status {stack_id}" does
not work, because we don't release resource lock, so this change
to release lock to make sure it works.

Change-Id: Ic42ad40e279c4e40da95d9aee35125767e747124
Closes-Bug: #1622533
(cherry picked from commit 4bd9b81fbbaaf3bd3e0294a2143cb4e61b34ece8)

commit_message:
Add MULTI_REGION flag and new role

Currently "multinode" topology is supported in devstack gate,
but unfortunately only single OpenStack region is applicable.

This patch is to add new role "subnode_multi_region" in feature
matrix to enable OpenStack services in subnode(s). To make OpenStack
multi-region gate/check job can work ASAP, only two nodes(one primary
node as RegionOne, one subnode as RegionTwo) will be supported
at first stage.

Environment variable MULTI_REGION is added to make it possible to
setup the multi-region parameters in localrc for RegionOne and
RegionTwo.

This patch has dependency on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386072

Change-Id: I2a5f846ec21f67d63efcfc39d449613a86c3081d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/53/409653/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$MULTI_REGION" -eq "1" ]]; then test_matrix_role='subnode_multi_region' fi if [[ "$MULTI_REGION" -eq "1" ]]; then # set the second region to use primary region's keystone if [[ "$role" = sub ]]; then # currently only two region supported, so it's ok to do so. # enhance here to support more than one sub-nodes local sub_node=`cat /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private` echo "HOST_IP=$sub_node" >>"$localrc_file" echo "SERVICE_HOST=$HOST_IP" >>"$localrc_file" echo "REGION_NAME=RegionTwo" >>"$localrc_file" echo "KEYSTONE_REGION_NAME=RegionOne" >>"$localrc_file" echo "KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" echo "KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" echo "HOST_IP=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" echo "REGION_NAME=RegionOne" >>"$localrc_file" else # non-multi-region mode if [[ "$role" = sub ]]; then if [[ $original_enabled_services =~ "qpid" ]]; then echo "QPID_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" fi if [[ $original_enabled_services =~ "rabbit" ]]; then echo "RABBIT_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" fi echo "DATABASE_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" if [[ $original_enabled_services =~ "mysql" ]]; then echo "DATABASE_TYPE=mysql" >>"$localrc_file" else echo "DATABASE_TYPE=postgresql" >>"$localrc_file" fi echo "GLANCE_HOSTPORT=$primary_node:9292" >>"$localrc_file" echo "Q_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" # Set HOST_IP in subnodes before copying localrc to each node else echo "HOST_IP=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" fi
deleted_lines: if [[ "$role" = sub ]]; then if [[ $original_enabled_services =~ "qpid" ]]; then echo "QPID_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" fi if [[ $original_enabled_services =~ "rabbit" ]]; then echo "RABBIT_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" fi echo "DATABASE_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" if [[ $original_enabled_services =~ "mysql" ]]; then echo "DATABASE_TYPE=mysql" >>"$localrc_file" echo "DATABASE_TYPE=postgresql" >>"$localrc_file" echo "GLANCE_HOSTPORT=$primary_node:9292" >>"$localrc_file" echo "Q_HOST=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file" # Set HOST_IP in subnodes before copying localrc to each node else echo "HOST_IP=$primary_node" >>"$localrc_file"

commit_message:
[working-in-progress]Port all neutron and nova-net to Network service

Changes:
- All /rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/utils.py's nova-net is
deprecated in favour of network service
- All /rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/utils.py is deprecated in
favour of network service too
- All existing scenarios related to network are ported to Network service

Change-Id: I0594c46c5bf96006f1325de0f83412e0a585bf44

added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import collections from rally.common import utils import netaddr from rally.plugins.openstack import service cidr_incr = utils.RAMInt() Network = collections.namedtuple("Network", ["id", "status", "name", "subnets", "external", "project_id", "tenant_id", "qos_policy_id"]) class UnifiedNetwork(service.UnifiedOpenStackService): @staticmethod def _generate_cidr(start_cidr="10.2.0.0/24"): """Generate next CIDR for network or subnet, without IP overlapping. This is process and thread safe, because `cidr_incr' points to value stored directly in RAM. This guarantees that CIDRs will be serial and unique even under hard multiprocessing/threading load. :param start_cidr: start CIDR str :returns: next available CIDR str """ cidr = str(netaddr.IPNetwork(start_cidr).next(next(cidr_incr))) return cidr def create_network(self, net_name, admin_state_up=False, ip_range=None, **kwargs): """Creating a new network and return a network object. :param net_name: Name of network to be created :param admin_state_up: The administrative state of the resouce :param ip_range: Nova create network need a ip_range(CIDR) param :param kwargs: Optional additional arguments for creating network """ return self._impl.create_network(net_name, admin_state_up, ip_range, kwargs) def list_networks(self): """List all networks.""" return self._impl.list_networks() def update_network(self, network_id, network_name, **kwargs): """Update network. :param network_id: ID of network which need to be updated :param network_name: Name of updated network :param kwargs: Optional additional arguments for updating network """ return self._impl.update_network(network_id, network_name, **kwargs) def delete_network(self, network_id): """Delete network.""" self._impl.delete_network(network_id) def create_port(self, port_name, network_id, project_id, **kwargs): """Add a port. :param port_name: Name of port to be created :param network_id: Neutron network ID :param project_id: The ID of project """ return self._impl.create_port(port_name, network_id, project_id, kwargs) def list_ports(self): """List users' ports. """ return self._impl.list_ports() def update_port(self, port_id, port_name, device_id, device_owner, admin_statet_up=False, **kwargs): """Update port. :param port_id: ID of port to be updated :param port_name: Name of updated port :param device_id: The ID of device that uses this port :param device_owner: The ID of the entity that uses this port :param admin_statet_up: The administrative state of the resource :param kwargs: Optional additional arguments for updating port """ return self._impl.update_port(port_id, port_name, device_id, device_owner, admin_statet_up, kwargs) def delete_port(self, port_id): """Delete port.""" self._impl.delete_port(port_id) def create_security_group(self, security_group_name, project_id=None, **kwargs): """Create security group. :param security_group_name: Name of security group to be created :param project_id: The ID of project :param kwargs: Optional additional arguments for creating security group """ return self._impl.create_security_group(security_group_name, project_id, kwargs) def list_security_groups(self): """List all security groups.""" return self._impl.list_security_groups() def update_security_group(self, security_group_id=None, security_group_name=None, description=None): """Update security group. :param security_group_id: ID of security group which need to be updated :param security_group_name: Name of updated security group :param description: Description of updated security group """ return self._impl.update_security_group( security_group_id, security_group_name, description) def delete_security_group(self, security_group_id): """Delete security group.""" self._impl.delete_security_group(security_group_id) def create_router(self, network_id, name=None, admin_state_up=False, external_fixed_ips=None, **kwargs): """Create router. :param network_id: ID of network which the router gateway is connected to. :param name: Name of router :param admin_state_up: The administrative state of resource. :param external_fixed_ips: IP address(es) of the external gateway interface of the router. The body of this param include ip_address and subnet_id. :param kwargs: Optional additional arguments for creating router """ return self._impl.create_router(network_id, name, admin_state_up, external_fixed_ips, kwargs) def list_routers(self): """List routers.""" return self._impl.list_routers() def update_router(self, router_id, external_fixed_ips, router_name=None, admin_state_up=False, enable_snat=False): """Update router. :param router_id: ID of router which router need to be updated :param external_fixed_ips: IP address(es) of the external gateway interface of the updated router. The body of this param include ip_address and subnet_id. :param router_name: Name of updated router :param admin_state_up: The administrative state of the resource. :param enable_snat: Enable source NAT attribute """ return self._impl.update_router(router_id, external_fixed_ips, router_name, admin_state_up, enable_snat) def delete_router(self, router_id): """Delete router. :param router_id: ID of router which need to be deleted """ self._impl.delete_router(router_id) def create_subnet(self, network_id, ip_version, cidr): """Create subnet. :param network_id: ID of network which the subnet belongs. :param ip_version: The ip protocol version :param cidr: The CIDR of subnet """ return self._impl.create_subnet(network_id, ip_version, cidr) def list_subnets(self): """List subnets.""" return self._impl.list_subnets() def update_subnet(self, subnet_id, subnet_name=None, **kwargs): """Update subnet :param subnet_id: ID of subnet which need to be updated. :param subnet_name: Name of updated subnet :param kwargs: Optional additional arguments for updating subnet """ return self._impl.update_subnet(subnet_id, subnet_name, kwargs) def delete_subnet(self, subnet_id): """Delete subnet. :param: subnet_id: ID of subnet which need to be deleted. """ self._impl.delete_subnet(subnet_id)
